intro: Navarretia leucocephala, commonly known as the white-flowered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as coastal bluffs and grasslands. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Navarretia leucocephala is also known for its ability to thrive in coastal climates with mild temperatures and moderate rainfall.
